intro: Fissistigma pallens, commonly known as the pale fissistigma, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, particularly found in countries like India and China. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, pale yellow to greenish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a hairy texture. Fissistigma pallens is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in warm, humid climates.
